ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course taught me about the different aspects of cancer, cancer research, and cancer therapy and then gave us the chance to research a cancer topic of choice and devise a new therapy that can improve on current methods and address their shortcomings.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was strong because it gave us a firm foundation of what is out there in the world of cancer research and therapy, then gave us the chance to be creative and come up with ways to further the field. The papers assigned for each week served to help us understand many different aspects of cancer and by having us give rotation weekly presentations it also allowed us to be more familiar with a few topics as we needed to go more in depth in order to prepare our presentations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student if they are interested in cancer research and treatment as it gives a good overview of the current field, the pros and cons of each method, and lets you think critically about what is there to be added to further the advances of the field.
